lines.text: Almost his last words were a threat to return from the dead. In my opinion, he was mad!
That's the last time I'll ever try to make coffee in a strange house!
I happened to be staying in the neighborhood, and hearing of your master's illness I took the liberty of calling. How is he tonight?
He'll never see the morning.
He has not asked for anyone of my cloth?
Nor will he. He's set in his ways, and they are the ways of the heathen.
I know he won't see the rector, but though I'm a comparative stranger, I don't like to leave a man to die like that.
He'll die in his own fashion as he has lived.
Still, sometimes at the end...
Not him! He's stubborn and unbending and will be so at the throne itself!
You're afraid of me!

[Shakes his head]
I'm afraid FOR you.

[Referring to the jewel]
If this should leave me, you'll have reason to fear... for when the full moon strikes the door of my tomb, I will come back. You hear? I will come back to kill!

[referring to Morlant]
What was the idea of bandaging his hand like that?
I cannot say. He had many a queer fancy.
We all know that dead men don't come back.
I'm sorry there should be this sort of atmosphere. After all, we're only ships that pass in the night.
Hmmm. Do you want a drink, or will you pass now?

[as the romantic Kaney is making tea for the household]
Six cups? That's just... just four too many.
[Grabbing her hand]
Eh?
Tell me about Egypt. Have you ever seen a shiek?

[Imperiously folding his arms a la Valentino]
I am one!

[Shocked]
What?
I advise you to be very careful, Laing.
I've a careful nature.
You may be putting yourself perilously near dishonesty.
I've seen men nearer.
